intro: Prunus virginiana var. melanocarpa, commonly known as the black-cherry, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to eastern North America. It produces small, dark red to black berries that are an important food source for birds and small mammals. The plant has alternate, simple, ovate leaves with serrated edges and a distinctive reddish-brown bark. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained, loamy soils. The black-cherry is also valued for its ornamental qualities and historical use in traditional medicine.
